Description: Body sherd of East Greek, possibly Aeolian, grey ware pottery vessel, possibly krater; interior: reserved; exterior: very worn dark grey slip; decoration in relief consisting of dot, probably from the end of a tendril.
Curator's comments: For similarities with other Grey Ware sherds, see British Museum 1888,0601.644.h and 1888,0601.644.l. The fabric and decorative techniques find parallels with British Museum 1888,0601.644.c. This sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn). The origin of the fabric (NAUK 47) was not identified and considered a chemical singleton.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 56, Table 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.118)
